==Dialogue==
{{Dialogue Start}}
;(Available after completing ''[[Were It So Easy]]'')
:'''Cosanzeana:''' Ah, are you here to see my flower garden today?
:{{DIcon}} How are our exotic flowers doing?
::'''Cosanzeana:''' After the ugly machine got dug out, no bad Breacher Primuses returned to make a mess of things.
::'''Cosanzeana:''' As such, my precious exotic flowers are growing healthily!
:{{DIcon}} How's your cultivation of new flowers proceeding?
::'''Cosanzeana:''' ...To be honest, I don't know where to start just yet.
::'''Cosanzeana:''' But if I can make the leaves of these flowers grow into the shape of Tidalga, I might be able to shock the world at the next horticultural fair!
;(After Step 3 of ''[[There Will Come Soft Rains]]'')
:{{DIcon}} About the earthquake just a while ago...
::'''Cosanzeana:''' Th&mdash;That was so scary! Thankfully, my garden's alright...
::'''Cosanzeana:''' I thought that some bad guys were coming to ruin it again... But I've got to protect the flowers we worked so hard to grow together!
:{{DIcon}} I'm just passing through...
::'''Cosanzeana:''' Okay &mdash; I mean, cheering people up is one of the reasons for which flower gardens exist. I hope they'll be able to raise your spirits today, too!
{{Dialogue End}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* Cosanzeana's name comes from the traditional Romanian name, {{w|Ileana Cosânzeana}}. Ileana Cosânzeana is a recurring character in Romanian fairytales and myths. She has always been depicted as a young, beautiful and kind hearted fairy or princess.
